title: Add a Title Page that Shows App Name and Owner Name

requirements.text: Make the app open on a dedicated title page at route "/" that prominently displays the project/app name and the owner name, in English.

quotes: add title page featuring the name and owner name

acceptanceCriteria: When the app loads, the first screen shown is the title page at route "/" (not the gallery).
The title page shows the app name "ANIMEXIS" prominently.
The title page shows the owner name prominently (not only in the footer) in English (e.g., "Created by Ashwath").

requirements.text: Update the existing letter-by-letter title component to support rendering both the app name and an owner-name line (subtitle or secondary line) as part of the title-page hero content.

quotes: add title page featuring the name and owner name

acceptanceCriteria: The title ("ANIMEXIS") still renders with the existing letter-by-letter reveal behavior (or an equivalent reduced-motion-safe presentation).
The owner name line renders as part of the hero/title block (not only the footer) and is visible without scrolling.
If the user prefers reduced motion, both lines appear without animated reveal.

requirements.text: Provide a clear, non-scroll-gated way to proceed from the title page to the existing gallery page ("/gallery") without reintroducing scroll-to-enter gating.

quotes: add title page featuring the name and owner name

acceptanceCriteria: From the title page, the user can navigate to the gallery via an explicit UI affordance (e.g., a subtle text link/button).
Navigation does not require scrolling/touch gestures to unlock/enter the gallery.
After navigating to the gallery, the gallery behaves as it does today.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not modify immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them if needed).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No changes to the anime data model or gallery section layout beyond what is needed to support the new title page.
No third-party authentication or external integrations.
